item.title: Are Cyborgs In Our Future? 'Homo Deus' Author Thinks So
item.description: February 21, 2017 - Yuval Noah Harari expects we'll soon engineer our bodies in the same way we design products. "I think in general medicine ... will switch from healing the sick to upgrading the healthy," he says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - Yuval Noah Harari expects we'll soon engineer our bodies in the same way we design products. "I think in general medicine ... will switch from healing the sick to upgrading the healthy," he says. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/21/516484639/are-cyborgs-in-our-future-homo-deus-author-thinks-so

item.title: Uber Orders Investigation Into Sexual Harassment Claims
item.description: February 20, 2017 - A former engineer for the ride-hailing app Uber published a blog post this weekend claiming that she faced sexual harassment while working at the company. Uber says it's investigating the allegations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - A former engineer for the ride-hailing app Uber published a blog post this weekend claiming that she faced sexual harassment while working at the company. Uber says it's investigating the allegations. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/20/516292319/uber-orders-investigation-into-sexual-harassment-claims

item.title: '#Republic' Author Describes How Social Media Hurts Democracy
item.description: February 20, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers speaks to Cass Sunstein about his new book, #Republic: Divided Democracy in the Age of Social Media. He says democracy needs people to come across a variety of viewpoints, and much of social media limits that exposure.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers speaks to Cass Sunstein about his new book, #Republic: Divided Democracy in the Age of Social Media. He says democracy needs people to come across a variety of viewpoints, and much of social media limits that exposure. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/20/516292286/-republic-author-describes-how-social-media-hurts-democracy

item.title: Uber Will Investigate Sexual Harassment Claims By Engineer
item.description: February 20, 2017 - Uber's CEO has ordered an investigation into a sexual harassment claim made by a female engineer after she published a blog post detailing her experience.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - Uber's CEO has ordered an investigation into a sexual harassment claim made by a female engineer after she published a blog post detailing her experience. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/20/516260638/uber-will-investigate-sexual-harassment-claims-by-engineer

item.title: Facebook Wants Great Power, But What About Responsibility?
item.description: February 19, 2017 - Mark Zuckerberg has announced a plan to make Facebook the only primary platform people use to connect to others virtually. But he fails to discuss the responsibilities that come with that power.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - Mark Zuckerberg has announced a plan to make Facebook the only primary platform people use to connect to others virtually. But he fails to discuss the responsibilities that come with that power. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/19/516094134/facebook-wants-great-power-but-what-about-responsibility

item.title: Your Shareable Google Maps Lists May Be Really Interesting To Advertisers
item.description: February 18, 2017 - A new feature allows users to create lists of places and share them with friends. Is Google Maps trying to become a social network or to collect more information about its users? Maybe both.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 18, 2017 - A new feature allows users to create lists of places and share them with friends. Is Google Maps trying to become a social network or to collect more information about its users? Maybe both. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/18/515564392/your-shareable-google-maps-lists-may-be-really-interesting-to-advertisers

item.title: Local Police Departments Invest In Cell Phone Spy Tools
item.description: February 17, 2017 - As we depend on our cell phones more and more, the tools to peek into our phones are getting better. Local police departments across the country are investing heavily in this technology. And, with few laws governing what police can collect and store, that has a lot of privacy advocates alarmed. NPR's Robert Siegel talks to City Lab reporter George Joseph about the spread of tools that let police collect cell phone data.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 17, 2017 - As we depend on our cell phones more and more, the tools to peek into our phones are getting better. NPR's Robert Siegel talks to City Lab reporter George Joseph about the spread of tools that let police collect cell phone data. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/17/515841069/local-police-departments-invest-in-cell-phone-spy-tools

item.title: Scientific Conference Planners Concerned About Immigration Policy
item.description: February 17, 2017 - There's increasing concern among planners of science and technical conferences about the Trump administration's immigration restrictions. Many groups signed a letter asking Trump to rescind the order.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 17, 2017 - There's increasing concern among planners of science and technical conferences about the Trump administration's immigration restrictions. Many groups signed a letter asking Trump to rescind the order. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/17/515785189/scientific-conference-planners-concerned-about-immigration-policy

item.title: Banned In Germany: Kids' Doll Is Labeled An Espionage Device
item.description: February 17, 2017 - The doll Cayla looks like an everyday toy and gives no notice that it collects and transmits everything it hears, German regulators say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 17, 2017 - The doll Cayla looks like an everyday toy and gives no notice that it collects and transmits everything it hears, German regulators say. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/17/515775874/banned-in-germany-kids-doll-is-labeled-an-espionage-device

item.title: The Turtles Lose Case Over Rights To Their Oldies In New York
item.description:
February 17, 2017 - Members of The Turtles lost their New York class action in a ruling from the state's appeals court.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/02/17/515770648/the-turtles-lose-case-over-rights-to-their-oldies-in-new-york

item.title: Using The Blockchain To Change Prisons
item.description: February 17, 2017 - Charlie Shrem went to prison for his involvement in Bitcoin trading. Now he's out and part of the next evolution of Bitcoin's future, investments that trade using Bitcoin's underlying technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 17, 2017 - Charlie Shrem went to prison for his involvement in Bitcoin trading. Now he's out and part of the next evolution of Bitcoin's future, investments that trade using Bitcoin's underlying technology. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/17/515728601/using-the-blockchain-to-change-prisons

item.title: Yahoo Warns More Users That Their Private Information May Have Been Stolen
item.description: February 16, 2017 - The company warned some users that their accounts may have been accessed using forged cookies in connection with a previously disclosed hack in 2014.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 16, 2017 - The company warned some users that their accounts may have been accessed using forged cookies in connection with a previously disclosed hack in 2014. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/16/515568599/yahoo-warns-more-users-that-their-private-information-may-have-been-stolen

item.title: Recipe For New Sports? Just Add A Drone
item.description: February 16, 2017 - You may have heard of drone racing, but people keep coming up with new ways to enjoy these flying machines. A Latvian firm has developed a drone to pull snowboarders in a sport called "droneboarding."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 16, 2017 - You may have heard of drone racing, but people keep coming up with new ways to enjoy these flying machines. A Latvian firm has developed a drone to pull snowboarders in a sport called "droneboarding." http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/16/515199129/recipe-for-new-sports-just-add-a-drone

item.title: The South Has Been Slow To Harness Its Wind, But That's Changing
item.description: February 16, 2017 - There are several reasons the region is lagging in wind energy — including lower wind speeds. But now North Carolina is home to the first large-scale commercial wind farm in the Southeast.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 16, 2017 - There are several reasons the region is lagging in wind energy — including lower wind speeds. But now North Carolina is home to the first large-scale commercial wind farm in the Southeast. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/16/515376114/the-south-has-been-slow-to-harness-its-wind-but-thats-changing

item.title: 5 Ways Teachers Are Fighting Fake News
item.description: February 16, 2017 - In an era of national attention to what's real and what isn't, we asked educators to share their strategies for helping students sort out fact from fiction.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 16, 2017 - In an era of national attention to what's real and what isn't, we asked educators to share their strategies for helping students sort out fact from fiction. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/02/16/514364210/5-ways-teachers-are-fighting-fake-news
